Brownsville.XELD-TV:
XELD-TV was a television station licensed to Matamoros, Tamaulipas, Mexico, broadcasting in English and Spanish for the Río Grande Valley region. The station broadcast on channel 7 from September 15, 1951, to April 1954.


== History ==


=== Opening ===
The 1948 freeze on new television station licenses placed by the Federal Communications Commission in the United States stalled any development of television on the American side of the Río Grande, which was allotted VHF channels 4 and 5.
